ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
The client seems to make it difficult to arrange appointments
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: When a visit is arranged, the client is available
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client seems to avoid making appointments
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: If you offer advice, does the client usually resist it?
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client takes an active part in the setting of goals or treatment plans
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client actively participates in managing his/her illness
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client seeks help when assistance is needed
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client finds it difficult to ask for help
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client seeks help to prevent a crisis
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client does not actively seek help
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client agrees to take prescribed medication
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client is clear about what medications he/she is taking and why
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client refuses to cooperate with treatment
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: The client has difficulty in adhering to the prescribed medication
Notes: 0= Not at all or rarely; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Most of the time

ElementDescription: Service Engagement Scale (SES) Total Score
Notes: Sum of service_engage1-14 with items 2, 5-6, 7, 9, 11-12 reverse coded; higher scores indicate greater difficulty engaging with services

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
